abstract: Some high-profile Democrats, including former New York City Comptroller William C Thompson Jr, are urging Rep Hakeem Jeffries of Brooklyn to run against Mayor Bill de Blasio in 2017; group sees Jeffries as only candidate other than current Comptroller Scott M Stringer able to win support from both black voters and wealthy white political donors.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Jeffries, a second-term congressman, has emerged as a powerful magnet for Mayor Bill de Blasio’s opponents and possibly, if Mr. Jeffries changes his mind, a genuine threat to his re-election.

headline.main: Hakeem Jeffries for New York Mayor? Some Democrats Say Yes, but He Hesitates
headline.print_headline: Congressman Is Urged to Challenge de Blasio in 2017, but He Hesitates

snippet: Mr. Jeffries, a second-term congressman, has emerged as a powerful magnet for Mayor Bill de Blasio’s opponents and possibly, if Mr. Jeffries changes his mind, a genuine threat to his re-election.
